bibl.title: Despatch from S. S. Sevier to Thomas F. Bayard, September 16, 1886
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Mr. Sevier to the Secretary of State, Washington
Acknowledgement of Despatch No. 6, dated July 15, 1886, and of flags, seal, and blank drafts.

Despatch No. 6, dated July 15, 1886 to late Consul Genl. Moses A. Hopkins acknowledged, above two flags, a seal and press and blank drafts. Request for estimate of cost of furniture noted, and paragraph of Consular Regulations refered to.
Hon. T. F. Bayard, Secretary of State, Washington

Sir, I have the honor of acknowledging your despatch of July 15th last (No. 6) addressed to the late Counsul General Hopkins, advising the sending to the Consulate General of two flags, a seal and press, and some blank drafts: all of which have been duly received.
request for estimate of cost of furnitutres; and the paragraph refered to in the Consular Regulations.
I have the honor to be, Sir, Your obediant Servant
Samuel S. Sevier Acting Consul Gen.
